entry.title: Combined summary - HTLC Endorsement for Jamming Mitigation
entry.summary: In a recent email thread on the Lightning-dev mailing list, the participants discussed the usefulness of reputation systems in the Lightning Network. Christian expressed doubts about their reliability due to sudden behavioral changes and whitewashing attacks. Antoine Riard proposed incorporating reputational transitivity between incoming and outgoing traffic channels in HTLC endorsement schemes to prevent abuse during high routing fees. Carla Kirk-Cohen shared updates on channel jamming and proposed a two-part scheme involving HTLC endorsement and reputation to gather data for future simulation work.Under this scheme, each node would locally track the reputation of its direct neighbors and allocate slots and liquidity based on their risk tolerance. Endorsed HTLCs from high reputation peers would be given priority, while unknown HTLCs would only be forwarded if there are available slots and liquidity. The discussion also highlighted the significance of gathering real-world data and experimenting with different algorithms for tracking local reputation.To facilitate collaboration and information sharing among developers and enthusiasts, the Lightning-dev mailing list serves as a valuable platform. Interested individuals can sign up for updates and notifications on the list's website. The Lightning Network community as a whole is actively engaged in mitigating channel jamming and exploring various reputation schemes and algorithms to enhance network security.In addition to the email thread, the speaker mentioned a page on the CLN implementation and lnmetrics as resources for gathering data and gaining a deeper understanding of the topic at hand. They suggested utilizing these resources to further explore the subject being discussed. Furthermore, the idea of creating an experimental data gathering mechanism for CLN using lnmetrics as a platform was proposed. The speaker expressed interest in discussing the necessary data to collect from the network and mentioned plans to write a machine learning post about lnmetrics.Overall, the participants in this conversation are actively exploring ways to gather data and implement reputation-based systems for mitigating channel jamming attacks in the Lightning Network. They are making use of various platforms and resources to conduct experiments and collect real-world data to inform their future simulations and analysis.
